definition:
Let $R$ be a commutative ring having regular elements and let $T$ be the
total ring of fractions of $R$. Then $R \subseteq T$. Every subring of
$T$ containing $R$ is an [*overring*]{} of $R$.\
**Example.** Let $p$ be a rational prime number. The are the quotients
of two integers such that the is not divisible by $p$. The set of all
$p$-integral rationals is an overring of $\mathbb{Z}$.
